title: Ship in a weekend rule
content:
I set a rule: any new idea must ship a usable slice by Sunday night. That constraint forces scoping discipline what can a user see, click, and benefit from in two days?

The rule killed perfectionism. I picked defaults instead of settings, wrote shorter copy, and reused components instead of inventing new ones.

Most ideas fizzled quickly, which was the point. The few that survived became real features with proven demand.
